channel.title: box lacrosse on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in box lacrosse on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Albany FireWolves Logo
The Albany FireWolves are a professional box lacrosse team based in Albany, New York. They are members of the East Division of the National Lacrosse League and will begin play in the 2021-22 season at the Times Union Center. The team is owned by a group headed by former NLL player Oliver Marti. The team relocated from Uncasville, Connecticut, where they were known as the New England Black Wolves. The Black Wolves themselves were a relocation of the Philadelphia Wings.
You can download theAlbany FireWolveslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Albany FireWolves
item.description: The Albany FireWolves are a professional box lacrosse team based in Albany, New York. They are members of the East Division of the National Lacrosse League and will begin play in the 2021-22 season at the Times Union Center. The team is owned by a group headed by former NLL player Oliver Marti. The team relocated from Uncasville, Connecticut, where they were known as the New England Black Wolves. The Black Wolves themselves were a relocation of the Philadelphia Wings.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Buffalo Bandits Logo
The Buffalo Bandits are a professional box lacrosse team in the North Division of the National Lacrosse League. They play at the KeyBank Center in Buffalo, New York. The Bandits played in the Major Indoor Lacrosse League from 1992 to 1997, then in its successor the NLL since 1998. The Bandits are owned by Hockey Western New York LLC, a division of Pegula Sports and Entertainment led by Terry Pegula who also owns the Buffalo Sabres and the Buffalo Bills.
You can download theBuffalo Banditslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Buffalo Bandits
item.description: The Buffalo Bandits are a professional box lacrosse team in the North Division of the National Lacrosse League. They play at the KeyBank Center in Buffalo, New York. The Bandits played in the Major Indoor Lacrosse League from 1992 to 1997, then in its successor the NLL since 1998. The Bandits are owned by Hockey Western New York LLC, a division of Pegula Sports and Entertainment led by Terry Pegula who also owns the Buffalo Sabres and the Buffalo Bills.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Calgary Roughnecks Logo
The Calgary Roughnecks are a professional box lacrosse team based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. They are members of the Western Division of the National Lacrosse League and play their home games at Scotiabank Saddledome. The team name is derived from the roughnecks who work drilling rigs in Alberta’s oil and gas industry. The team is affectionately known by fans as the Riggers. The Roughnecks were founded in 2001, their first season was 2002, and they have qualified for the post-season every year from 2003 to 2016.
You can download theCalgary Roughneckslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Calgary Roughnecks
item.description: The Calgary Roughnecks are a professional box lacrosse team based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. They are members of the Western Division of the National Lacrosse League and play their home games at Scotiabank Saddledome. The team name is derived from the roughnecks who work drilling rigs in Alberta’s oil and gas industry. The team is affectionately known by fans as the Riggers. The Roughnecks were founded in 2001, their first season was 2002, and they have qualified for the post-season every year from 2003 to 2016.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Colorado Mammoth Logo
The Colorado Mammoth are a box lacrosse team playing in the National Lacrosse League. The Mammoth have played at Ball Arena in Denver, Colorado, since the 2003 season. They are owned by Stan Kroenke, who is also the owner of the Colorado Avalanche, Denver Nuggets and the Colorado Rapids of the MLS. The Mammoth franchise previously played as the Baltimore Thunder from 1987 to 1999, the Pittsburgh CrosseFire in 2000, and the Washington Power from 2001 to 2002.
You can download theColorado Mammothlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Colorado Mammoth
item.description: The Colorado Mammoth are a box lacrosse team playing in the National Lacrosse League. The Mammoth have played at Ball Arena in Denver, Colorado, since the 2003 season. They are owned by Stan Kroenke, who is also the owner of the Colorado Avalanche, Denver Nuggets and the Colorado Rapids of the MLS. The Mammoth franchise previously played as the Baltimore Thunder from 1987 to 1999, the Pittsburgh CrosseFire in 2000, and the Washington Power from 2001 to 2002.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Georgia Swarm Logo
The Georgia Swarm are a box lacrosse team in the East Division of the National Lacrosse League. They have been playing at the 13,000-seat Gas South Arena in Duluth, Georgia since their 2016 season. The team was formed as the Minnesota Swarm and played at the Xcel Energy Center in Saint Paul, Minnesota from 2004 until 2015. On May 22, 2015, team owner John Arlotta announced that the Xcel Energy Center, home of the Swarm, did not renew the contract for the team.
You can download theGeorgia Swarmlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

You can download theNew York Riptidelogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 National Lacrosse League Logo
The National Lacrosse League is a men’s professional box lacrosse league in North America. Headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the NLL currently has thirteen teams: eight in the United States and five in Canada. The NLL ranks third in average attendance for pro indoor sports worldwide, behind only the NHL and NBA. Unlike other box lacrosse leagues which play in the summer, the NLL plays its games in the winter and spring, from December to June.
You can download theNLLlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: NLL
item.description: The National Lacrosse League is a men’s professional box lacrosse league in North America. Headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the NLL currently has thirteen teams: eight in the United States and five in Canada. The NLL ranks third in average attendance for pro indoor sports worldwide, behind only the NHL and NBA. Unlike other box lacrosse leagues which play in the summer, the NLL plays its games in the winter and spring, from December to June.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Rochester Knighthawks Logo
The Rochester Knighthawks are a professional box lacrosse team in the North Division of the National Lacrosse League. They play in Rochester, New York at the Blue Cross Arena at the War Memorial. The Knighthawks are owned by Pegula Sports and Entertainment who purchased the intellectual property of the team from former owner Curt Styres who moved the previous version of the team to Halifax, Nova Scotia as the Halifax Thunderbirds at the end of the 2018-2019 season.
You can download theRochester Knighthawkslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

San Diego Seals Logo The San Diego Seals are a box lacrosse team in the National Lacrosse League. They play their home games at the Pechanga Arena in San Diego, California. The 2018-2019 season was their inaugural season. Source
You can download theSan Diego Sealslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: San Diego Seals

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Saskatchewan Rush Logo The Saskatchewan Rush are a professional box lacrosse team based in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada. Formerly the Edmonton Rush, they are members of the Western Division of the National Lacrosse League and play their home games at Co-op Field at SaskTel Centre. The Rush have won the Champion’s Cup twice since their move to Saskatchewan: their first season in 2016, and again in 2018. Source
You can download theSaskatchewan Rushlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Saskatchewan Rush
item.description: The Saskatchewan Rush are a professional box lacrosse team based in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada. Formerly the Edmonton Rush, they are members of the Western Division of the National Lacrosse League and play their home games at Co-op Field at SaskTel Centre. The Rush have won the Champion’s Cup twice since their move to Saskatchewan: their first season in 2016, and again in 2018. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Toronto Rock Logo
The Toronto Rock are a professional box lacrosse franchise based in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. They are members of the North Division of the National Lacrosse League. The team was the first Canadian franchise in the NLL. Oakville resident Jamie Dawick is the current owner of the Rock, purchasing the team after the 2009 season. Since 2014, Dawick has also served as their general manager. The Rock play their home games at FirstOntario Centre which they currently share with both the Hamilton Bulldogs of the OHL and the Hamilton Honey Badgers of the CEBL.
You can download theToronto Rocklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

Since 2014, Dawick has also served as their general manager. The Rock play their home games at FirstOntario Centre which they currently share with both the Hamilton Bulldogs of the OHL and the Hamilton Honey Badgers of the CEBL.
